org.hps.readout

Class RawConverterReadoutDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.readout.RawConverterReadoutDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EcalRawConverterReadoutDriver, HodoscopeRawConverterReadoutDriver

    public abstract class RawConverterReadoutDriver
extends ReadoutDriver
    RawConverterReadoutDriver processes ADC hit data objects and converts them to energy hit objects. It serves as an interface to a AbstractMode3RawConverter object, where the actual conversion is performed.

    RawConverterReadoutDriver itself is abstract - it requires that implementing classes handle any subdetector-specific functionality.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.lcsim.util.Driver

      • getTimeDisplacement

        protected final double getTimeDisplacement()
        Description copied from class: ReadoutDriver
        Specifies the amount of simulation time that the driver needs to produce its output. This indicates that the driver's present output was generated based on input a time equal to (getCurrentTime() - getTimeDisplacement()).
        Specified by:
        getTimeDisplacement in class ReadoutDriver
        Returns:
        Returns the time displacement of output data as a double.

      • getTimeNeededForLocalOutput

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • isBadChannel

        protected boolean isBadChannel(long channelID)
        Indicates whether or not the channel on which a hit occurs is a "bad" channel according to the conditions database.
        Parameters:
        hit - - The hit to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the hit channel is flagged as "bad" and false otherwise.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if the subdetector represented by the driver does not support bad channel exclusion.

      • updateDetectorDependentParameters

        detector - - The current detector geometry.

      • setNumberSamplesAfter

        public void setNumberSamplesAfter(int samples)
        Sets the number of integration samples that should be included in a pulse integral after the threshold-crossing event.
        Parameters:
        samples - - The number of samples, where a sample is a 4 ns clock-cycle.

      • setSkipBadChannels

        public void setSkipBadChannels(boolean state)
        Indicates whether or not data from channels flagged as "bad" in the conditions system should be ignored. true indicates that they should be ignored, and false that they should not.
        Parameters:
        apply - - true indicates that "bad" channels will be ignored and false that they will not.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Occurs if the subdetector represented by the driver does not support bad channel exclusion.

      • setReadoutWindow

        public void setReadoutWindow(int window)
        Sets the size of the ADC buffer. This is needed for proper handling of Mode-3 hits in the raw converter.
        Parameters:
        window - - The buffer size in units of 4 ns clock-cycles.
